intro: Tricliceras lobatum, commonly known as the lobed leaf fern, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive lobed fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features a creeping rhizome with clustered, leathery fronds that are often divided into lobes. Its foliage is typically dark green and can grow up to several feet in length. Tricliceras lobatum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
